ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Not aware of other people's feelings
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Does not realize when others are upset or angry
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Does not notice the effect of his/her behaviour on other members of the family
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Behavior often disrupts family life
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Very demanding of other people's time
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Difficult to reason with when upset
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Does not seem to understand social skills, e.g. persistently interrupts conversations
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Does not pick up on body language
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Does not appear to understand how to behave when out (e.g. in shops, or other people's homes)
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Does not realize if s/he offends people with her/his behavior
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Does not respond when told to do something
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Cannot follow a command unless it is carefully worded
Notes: 0 = Not true; 1 = Quite or sometimes true; 2 = Very or often true

ElementDescription: Sum of Social and Communication Disorders Checklist items 1 - 12
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Form used/assessment name
